snippet: While it prevailed in its legal argument, Starr International still thinks the government owes money to shareholders of the insurance giant.
abstract: Starr International, through which Maurice R Greenberg continues to hold stake in American International Group, will appeal judge's decision not to award monetary damages in its suit against the federal government; judge had concluded that while Federal Reserve overstepped its bounds during bailout of AGI, no damages were appropriate, given that shareholders were in fact saved from bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: While it prevailed in its legal argument, Starr International still thinks the government owes money to shareholders of the insurance giant.

headline.main: Greenberg’s Firm Vows to Appeal A.I.G. Ruling
headline.print_headline: Firm of Former A.I.G. Chief Will Appeal, Seeking Damages
